columns.name: id
columns.description: The ID that Cloud Map assigned to the service when you created it.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that Cloud Map assigns to the service when you create it.

columns.name: create_date
columns.description: The date and time that the service was created.

columns.name: instance_count
columns.description: The number of instances that are currently associated with the service.

columns.name: type
columns.description: Describes the systems that can be used to discover the service instances. DNS_HTTP The service instances can be discovered using either DNS queries or the DiscoverInstances API operation. HTTP The service instances can only be discovered using the DiscoverInstances API operation. DNS Reserved.

columns.name: routing_policy
columns.description: The routing policy that you want to apply to all Route 53 DNS records that Cloud Map creates when you register an instance and specify this service.

columns.name: dns_records
columns.description: An array that contains one DnsRecord object for each Route 53 DNS record that you want Cloud Map to create when you register an instance.

columns.name: health_check_config
columns.description: Public DNS and HTTP namespaces only. Settings for an optional health check. If you specify settings for a health check, Cloud Map associates the health check with the records that you specify in DnsConfig.

columns.name: health_check_custom_config
columns.description: Information about an optional custom health check.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: Information about the tags associated with the namespace.
